snippet: Officials rejected accusations that President François Hollande might have been aware of the secret foreign bank accounts of an ex-budget minister and a campaign treasurer.
abstract: Firestorm surrounding former French budget minister Jerome Cahuzac's admission of having secret foreign bank accounts intensifies with revelation that Jean-Jacques Augier, co-treasurer of Pres Francois Hollande's 2012 election campaign, invested in offshore businesses in Cayman Islands; Augier claims he has done nothing illegal, and officials reject accusations that Hollande knew about secret accounts for months.

byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and NICOLA CLARK

lead_paragraph: Officials rejected accusations that President François Hollande might have been aware of the secret foreign bank accounts of an ex-budget minister and a campaign treasurer.

headline.seo: Uproar in France on Foreign Bank Accounts Deepens
headline.main: French Uproar on Secret Assets Escalates
headline.print_headline: French Uproar on Secret Assets Escalates
